'''Blockers''' are various items, blocks and mobs in ''[[Minecraft Blast]]'' that function to obstruct levels and create obstacles.

== List of blockers ==
The blockers are organized in the order they appear for the first time.
{| class="wikitable"
|+
!Name
!Image
!First Appearence
!Information
|-
|{{va|Dirt}} Blocker
|[[File:MCB Dirt Blocker.png|100px]]
|Level 1
|Dirt blockers can be destroyed by tapping on matching blocks next to it. 
|-
|{{va|Apple}} Blocker
|[[File:MCB Apple Blocker.png|100px]]
|Level 3
|Apple blockers can be destroyed by tapping on matching blocks next to it, and are affected by gravity. 
|-
|{{va|Canopy}} Blocker{{anchor|Leaves}}
|[[File:MCB Canopy Blocker.png|100px]]
|Level 6
|Canopy blockers (also known as leaves blockers) can be cleared by tapping on matching blocks right next to it. Once cleared, it will reveal the blocks/blockers hiding under them. Blocks can pass through canopy blockers. 
|-
|{{va|Sheep}} Blocker
|[[File:MCB Sheep Blocker.png|100px]]
|Level 10
|Sheep blockers are used to collect wool by tapping on matching blocks right next to it, shearing the wool. Once the wool is sheared off the sheep blocker, it will eat the grass below it and regrow its wool. Sheep blockers cannot be destroyed and will remain until the amount of wool needed has been achieved, removing the blocker.
|-
|{{va|Zombie}} Blocker
|[[File:MCB Zombie Blocker.png|100px]]
|Level 15
|Zombie blockers move and idle around their zombie lairs which are inaccessible to blocks. Zombie blockers can be removed by tapping on matching blocks right next to it. If all zombies within the lair are removed, the lair will disappear and now allow blocks to fill the space left behind by it. Zombies can come with either leather or gold helmets, increasing the number of matches required to remove them to 2 or 3 respectively.
|-
|{{va|Bookshelf}} Blocker
|[[File:MCB Book Blocker.png|100px]]
|Level 21
|Bookshelf blockers are 2x2 blockers that are used to collect books by making matches next to it. Once the player has tapped on matching blocks that is right next to the bookshelf blocker, it will remove a book, starting from the top left side and ending on the bottom right side. Once all 8 books from within the bookshelf blocker have been collected, it will be removed. 
|-
|{{va|Glass}} Blocker
|[[File:MCB Glass Blocker.png|100px]]
|Level 31
|Glass blockers can be cleared by breaking the blocks underneath it by matching the blocks next to it.
|-
|{{va|Chicken}} Blocker
|[[File:MCB Chicken Blocker.png|100px]]
|Level 41
|Chicken blockers require the player to get them to the very bottom of the level, once it has reached the bottom it will be collected.
|-
|{{va|Diorite}} Blocker
|[[File:MCB Diorite Blocker.png|100px]]
|Level 51
|Diorite blockers can be broken by making two matches right next to it, making one match next to it will crack the blocker. After two matches have been done next to the diorite blocker, it will be removed.  
|-
|{{va|Creeper}} Blocker
|[[File:MCB Creeper Blocker.png|100px]]
|Level 61
|Creeper blockers will idle and move around its lair. Creeper blockers can be exploded by making two consecutive matches next to it. Once one match has been done next to it, it will start to hiss and if another match is successfully done within the hiss, it will explode, destroying nearby blocks, but if the player fails to make a match next to the creeper blocker while it is hissing, it will go back to normal. 
|-
|{{va|Piston}} Blocker
|[[File:MCB_Piston_Blocker.png|100px]]
|Level 71
|Piston blockers can cover an entire row or column, and matches must be made next to it until it fully retracts. Once fully retracted, making another match next to it will remove it.
|-
|{{va|Cobweb}} Blocker
|[[File:MCB_Cobweb_Blocker.png|100px]]
|Level 81
|Cobweb blockers will cover blocks below them, making them not count towards matches, even if they're part of a valid match. They can come in various sizes, covering different areas of the board. They can be removed by making matches next to them, making the previously covered blocks now valid towards matches.
|-
|{{va|Flowerbed}} Blocker
|[[File:MCB_Flowerbed_Blocker.png|100px]]
|Level 91
|Flowerbed blockers are 2x2 blockers containing 4 flowers of different colours. Flowers can be removed by making a match next to the blocker with the corresponding color (yellow flowers are removed by yellow blocks, blue flowers are removed by blue blocks, etc.) or by boosters. Once all 4 flowers have been removed from a blocker, the blocker is removed.
|-
|{{va|Melon}} Blocker
|[[File:MCB_Melon_Blocker.png|100px]]
|Level 101
|Melon blockers can be broken by making two matches right next to it, and are affected by gravity. Making one match next to it will transfrom it into a watermelon slice, and after two matches have been done next to the melon blocker, it will be removed.
|-
|{{va|Spider}} Blocker
|[[File:MCB_Spider_Blocker.png|100px]]
|Level 121
|Spider blockers will idle and can move around different lairs. If a spider is not defeated after 1 move, they will move in their lair or jump to a different one. After 2 moves, they prepare to launch a cobweb. After 3 moves, they launch the cobweb to a random block, creating a cobweb blocker in said block. This cycle repeats until they're defeated by making a match next to them.
|-
|{{va|Carpet}} Blocker
|[[File:MCB_Carpet_Blocker.png|100px]]
|Level 141
|Carpet blockers block out pre-determined areas of the board, and can be removed by eliminating the required number of blocks of the corresponding color. Once removed, it'll reveal the blocks/blockers previously hidden underneath them. Carpet blockers do not count towards goals, but are still required to be removed in order to make a level beatable.
|-
|{{va|Flowerpot}} Blocker
|[[File:MCB_Flowerpot_Blocker.png|100px]]
|Level ???
|Flowerpot blockers are similar to flowerbed blockers in that they require matches of the corresponding color or boosters to be removed, but they occupy a single tile instead. They can come in 2 variants: single flower and 3 flowers, which require 1 or 2 matches respectively.
|-
|{{va|Obsidian}} Blocker
|[[File:MCB_Obisidian_Blocker.png|100px]]
|Level ???
|Obsidian blockers can only be destroyed with boosters (except end crystals since they only destroy blocks), making normal matches ineffective against them.
|}
